content.raw:
Sorry for not catching this sooner, but the `..._VISIBLE` macro should not be used on template declarations/definitions. I’ve found that when you do this, the linker \(especially for MSVC\) will expect all possible definitions for instantiations of the template to be explicitly defined in some library that you’re linking to, similar to something like

    extern template class SimpleWrapperPrivate</* ... AllPossibleArgumentTypes ... */>;

which is explained pretty well [here](https://stackoverflow.com/a/8131212).

\(… Or at least that’s how MSVC has behaved for me in the past.\)
content.html:
Sorry for not catching this sooner, but the ..._VISIBLE macro should not be used on template declarations/definitions. I’ve found that when you do this, the linker (especially for MSVC) will expect all possible definitions for instantiations of the template to be explicitly defined in some library that you’re linking to, similar to something like

extern template class SimpleWrapperPrivate</* ... AllPossibleArgumentTypes ... */>;

which is explained pretty well here.

(… Or at least that’s how MSVC has behaved for me in the past.)

update.description:
This pull request integrates ign-physics with ign-gazebo and provides basic capabilities for adding objects from ECS into the physics engine and updating their state at each simulation step.

A few notes:

* ~~Currently, there is ambiguity in the frame semantics of Pose components. When entities are created from SDF, the Pose component contains the pose of the entity relative to its parent. However, after the physics update, this Pose component holds the absolute pose of the entity. We might need to add a RelativePose component to implement frame semantics.~~
* A default physics time step of 1 ms is assumed.
* ~~One of the tests checks whether collisions are working and depends on a fix to ign-physics \(see~~ [~~this~~](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/32/feature-system-part-7-features-for/diff?w=1#comment-75815369)~~\) before it passes. My proposed fix is:~~ [~~PR ign-physics#35~~](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/35)
* ~~There is initial work on parsing joints, but I need to add more components to capture the various properties of joints. I haven’t written any code to add joints to the physics engine.~~
* Since this system depends on ign-physics, I’ve pulled it into its own library
* We currently don’t have a way to pass config parameters to systems so the path to the specific ign-physics plugin is passed by via a cmake define while it’s class name is hardcoded.

‌

## Update:

* I have removed joint parsing and the components associated with it. It will be it’s own pull request
* This pull request still depends on an open[ ign-physics pull request](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/32/)
update.title: Basic Physics System

content.raw: I don’t think we can depend on dartsim. It’s installed via a ppa, and I think this would prevent us from creating a debian.
content.html: I don’t think we can depend on dartsim. It’s installed via a ppa, and I think this would prevent us from creating a debian.

content.html: This probably shouldn’t be merged to default.

content.html: Since we are now using Register in null plugin, I think we can do away with this file altogether.

content.raw:
Couldn't we have a variant of `Each` that was not `const` specified?  Then we could have a variant of `Component` that also was not `const` specified, and the right methods would be called depending on if you had a `const EntityComponentManager` or a non-const variant.  It seems like using the `const_cast` in the EntityComponentManager is actually casting away some of the `const` correctness that we would want to have here.  
  
This would allow someone with a `const EntityComponentManager` the ability to modify components, which is undesireable.
content.html:
Couldn't we have a variant of Each that was not const specified? Then we could have a variant of Component that also was not const specified, and the right methods would be called depending on if you had a const EntityComponentManager or a non-const variant. It seems like using the const_cast in the EntityComponentManager is actually casting away some of the const correctness that we would want to have here.

This would allow someone with a const EntityComponentManager the ability to modify components, which is undesireable.

content.raw: This is now ready for review.

update.description:
This pull request integrates ign-physics with ign-gazebo and provides basic capabilities for adding objects from ECS into the physics engine and updating their state at each simulation step.

A few notes:

* ~~Currently, there is ambiguity in the frame semantics of Pose components. When entities are created from SDF, the Pose component contains the pose of the entity relative to its parent. However, after the physics update, this Pose component holds the absolute pose of the entity. We might need to add a RelativePose component to implement frame semantics.~~
* A default physics time step of 1 ms is assumed.
* One of the tests checks whether collisions are working and depends on a fix to ign-physics \(see [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/32/feature-system-part-7-features-for/diff?w=1#comment-75815369)\) before it passes. My proposed fix is:  [PR ign-physics#35](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/35)
* There is initial work on parsing joints, but I need to add more components to capture the various properties of joints. I haven’t written any code to add joints to the physics engine.
* Since this system depends on ign-physics, I’ve pulled it into its own library
* We currently don’t have a way to pass config parameters to systems so the path to the specific ign-physics plugin is passed by via a cmake define while it’s class name is hardcoded.

content.raw:
>Currently, there is ambiguity in the frame semantics of Pose components. When entities are created from SDF, the Pose component contains the pose of the entity relative to its parent. However, after the physics update, this Pose component holds the absolute pose of the entity. We might need to add a RelativePose component to implement frame semantics

All link poses are now relative to their parent model. The exception is the canonical link, which is assumed to be the first link in the model. The pose of a model is the same as the absolute pose of the canonical link.
content.html:
Currently, there is ambiguity in the frame semantics of Pose components. When entities are created from SDF, the Pose component contains the pose of the entity relative to its parent. However, after the physics update, this Pose component holds the absolute pose of the entity. We might need to add a RelativePose component to implement frame semantics

All link poses are now relative to their parent model. The exception is the canonical link, which is assumed to be the first link in the model. The pose of a model is the same as the absolute pose of the canonical link.

My proposed fix is:  [PR ign-physics#35](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/35)

* Since this system depends on ign-physics, I’ve pulled it into its own library
* We currently don’t have a way to pass config parameters to systems so the path to the specific ign-physics plugin is passed by via a cmake define while it’s class name is hardcoded.

update.title: [WIP]: Basic Physics System

update.description:
This pull request integrates ign-physics with ign-gazebo and provides basic capabilities for adding objects from ECS into the physics engine and updating their state at each simulation step.

A few notes:

* Currently, there is ambiguity in the frame semantics of Pose components. When entities are created from SDF, the Pose component contains the pose of the entity relative to its parent. However, after the physics update, this Pose component holds the absolute pose of the entity. We might need to add a RelativePose component to implement frame semantics.
* A default physics time step of 1 ms is assumed.
* One of the tests checks whether collisions are working and depends on a fix to ign-physics \(see [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/32/feature-system-part-7-features-for/diff?w=1#comment-75815369)\) before it passes. My proposed fix is: ign-physics#35.
* There is initial work on parsing joints, but I need to add more components to capture the various properties of joints. I haven’t written any code to add joints to the physics engine.
* Since this system depends on ign-physics, I’ve pulled it into its own library
* We currently don’t have a way to pass config parameters to systems so the path to the specific ign-physics plugin is passed by via a cmake define while it’s class name is hardcoded.
update.title: [WIP]: Basic Physics System

update.description:
This pull request integrates ign-physics with ign-gazebo and provides basic capabilities for adding objects from ECS into the physics engine and updating their state at each simulation step. 

A few notes:

* Currently, there is ambiguity in the frame semantics of Pose components. When entities are created from SDF, the Pose component contains the pose of the entity relative to its parent. However, after the physics update, this Pose component holds the absolute pose of the entity. We might need to add a RelativePose component to implement frame semantics.
* A default physics time step of 1 ms is assumed.
* One of the tests checks whether collisions are working and depends on a fix to ign-physics \(see [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/32/feature-system-part-7-features-for/diff?w=1#comment-75815369)\) before it passes. My proposed fix is: ign-physics#35.
* There is initial work on parsing joints, but I need to add more components to capture the various properties of joints. I haven’t written any code to add joints to the physics engine.
* Since this system depends on ign-physics, I’ve pulled it into its own library
* We currently don’t have a way to pass config parameters to systems so the path to the specific ign-physics plugin is passed by via a cmake define while it’s class name is hardcoded.
update.title: [WIP]: Basic Physics System

content.raw:
> We currently don’t have a way to pass config parameters to systems so the path to the specific ign-physics plugin is passed by via a cmake define while it’s class name is hardcoded.

The SDF element associated with the plugin could be passed either to the constructor or the Init function \(which was removed in the other PR\).
content.html:
We currently don’t have a way to pass config parameters to systems so the path to the specific ign-physics plugin is passed by via a cmake define while it’s class name is hardcoded.

The SDF element associated with the plugin could be passed either to the constructor or the Init function (which was removed in the other PR).

content.raw:
I resolved conflicts, and have installed ign-physics based on [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/32](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/32/feature-system-part-7-features-for/diff). I get the following build error:

/home/nkoenig/work/ignition/ign-gazebo/src/systems/Physics.cc:21:10: fatal error: ignition/physics/FeatureList.hh: No such file or directory  
\#include <ignition/physics/FeatureList.hh>
content.html:
I resolved conflicts, and have installed ign-physics based on #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/32. I get the following build error:

/home/nkoenig/work/ignition/ign-gazebo/src/systems/Physics.cc:21:10: fatal error: ignition/physics/FeatureList.hh: No such file or directory
#include <ignition/physics/FeatureList.hh>

update.description:
This pull request integrates ign-physics with ign-gazebo and provides basic capabilities for adding objects from ECS into the physics engine and updating their state at each simulation step. 

A few notes:

* Currently, there is ambiguity in the frame semantics of Pose components. When entities are created from SDF, the Pose component contains the pose of the entity relative to its parent. However, after the physics update, this Pose component holds the absolute pose of the entity. We might need to add a RelativePose component to implement frame semantics.
* A default physics time step of 1 ms is assumed.
* One of the tests checks whether collisions are working and depends on a fix to ign-physics \(see [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/32/feature-system-part-7-features-for/diff?w=1#comment-75815369)\) before it passes. My proposed fix is: ign-physics#35.
* There is initial work on parsing joints, but I need to add more components to capture the various properties of joints. I haven’t written any code to add joints to the physics engine.
* Since this system depends on ign-physics, I’ve pulled it into its own library
* We currently don’t have a way to pass config parameters to systems so the path to the specific ign-physics plugin is passed by via a cmake define while it’s class name is hardcoded.
update.title: [WIP]: Basic Physics System

However, after the physics update, this Pose component holds the absolute pose of the entity. We might need to add a RelativePose component to implement frame semantics.
* A default physics time step of 1 ms is assumed.
* One of the tests checks whether collisions are working and depends on a fix to ign-physics \(see [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-physics/pull-requests/32/feature-system-part-7-features-for/diff?w=1#comment-75815369)\) before it passes. My proposed fix is: ign-physics#35.

* Since this system depends on ign-physics, I’ve pulled it into its own library
* We currently don’t have a way to pass config parameters to systems so the path to the specific ign-physics plugin is passed by via a cmake define while it’s class name is hardcoded.
